div.head: For casting
div.ab: If you have some piece which will not release & is big, mold it with wax, either in hollow or in relief, because it is malleable once soft & obeys, and thus separates itself from the piece without leaving anything. But take heed that the melted wax be neither too hot nor too cold. Some mold with wax heated in hot water, but in pressing, the mold becomes clumsy & makes itself false. When you have the hollow wax form, you can cast in some very soft clay & thoroughly moistened & clear, & let it dry at ease. Then you will make a hollow form on it ave of lead or tin, in you which what you will form will be of good release.
